data: A blurring rain fell upon Paris that day; a rain so fine and cold that it penetrated the soles of menâ€™s shoes and their hearts alike, a dispiriting drizzle through which the pale, acrid smoke of innumerable wood fires faltered upward from the clustering chimney-pots, only to be rent into fragments and beaten down upon the glistening tiles of the mansard roofs.
